page.title: 14Thornton Annual Show
page.content: This event is held annually on the first Wednesday in August and this year's will be the 67th show. Until 1984 it was always held in the Hall field but has now moved to a larger site.The show has many events including horse-jumping, the showing of cattle, sheep and goats and sheepdog trials. {Visitors.}People come from as far away as Driffield,Whitby,Cleveland and Hull to take part in showing their animals {Competitions. }As well as animal competitions there are tent classes for Handcrafts,and Dairy and Garden Produce. Many locals enter these events. {Fund-raising.}There is a Thornton Show Whist drive each January, and a dinner dance. These events are organised by the secretary.
